definition: long queue/long line (of cars, people etc)
to form a long queue (idiom)/(of cars) to be bumper to bumper

sentences.english: At about half the distance to Zunyi, I came across a long line of cars.
sentences.chinese: 大約在去遵義的半道上我碰上了一串車排起了長龍。

sentences.english: There could be a long line at the ticket window.
sentences.chinese: 售票窗口可能會大排長龍。

sentences.english: Each day – even during the sweltering summer – thousands of visitors waited in long lines to enter Futurama.
sentences.chinese: 雖然烈日炎炎，但每天都有數千人大排長龍等待參觀。

sentences.english: Similarly, night clubs purposely make patrons wait at the door.
sentences.chinese: 同樣的，夜店也會故意讓常客在門口大排長龍。

sentences.english: Despite the long line of people that were already waiting in front of the shop, Nick lined up.
sentences.chinese: 儘管客人已在店前大排長龍，尼克還是排了隊。

sentences.english: The next day investors queued up to buy Freddie's bonds.
sentences.chinese: 翌日，投資人排起長龍，爭購房地美的債券。

sentences.english: Power shortages remain an almost daily occurrence and long lines greet drivers buying fuel.
sentences.chinese: 電力短缺每日可見，司機爲加油而大排長龍。

sentences.english: There already is a long line of lobbyists bidding for federal money.
sentences.chinese: 向聯邦政府伸手要錢的說客已經排成了一條長龍。

sentences.english: The queue is extremely long by the time Li arrives.
sentences.chinese: 李彥博趕到那時已經排起了長龍。

sentences.english: Some buildings advise patrons to arrive very early to pick up tickets to avoid long lines.
sentences.chinese: 有的售票處建議客人早些到當地取票，以免大排長龍。

sentences.english: No wonder you do not see long queues at the tills in many of the shops here.
sentences.chinese: 難怪在許多店裏都看不到收銀臺前排長龍的情形。

sentences.english: Pier plans Bo cut the waves, lying in the blue sea like a long queue silver wave.
sentences.chinese: 棧橋劃波斬浪，象一條長龍橫臥於碧海銀波。

sentences.english: There was a long line of people at the only ticket booth.
sentences.chinese: 票亭只有一個，所以大排長龍。

sentences.english: During the break, many people queues outside the toilet.
sentences.chinese: 小息的時候，廁所會排長龍。

sentences.english: The next day investors queued up to buy Freddie’s bonds.
sentences.chinese: 翌日，投資人排起長龍，爭購房地美的債券。

sentences.english: The marchers held a torchlight procession.
sentences.chinese: 遊行者排成了火炬長龍。

definition: colored lantern (used at Lantern Festival 元宵節|元宵节)
Doumen district of Zhuhai city 珠海市[Zhu1 hai3 shi4], Guangdong
carnival during the Lantern Festival, with lantern displays and traditional folk performances such as stilt walking and lion dance
to welcome a guest/to entertain a customer (of prostitute)
sea and land/ocean and continent/army and navy
endless stream of horse and carriages (idiom)/heavy traffic
the first stick of incense placed in the censer (believed to bring good luck esp. during festivities)/(slang) (Tw) the first reply to a blog post etc
